column2: a one and a half hour wait?  I know
column5: but it was nearly nine pm when we got there
column6: and they were still packed to the gills
column7: which brings me to my second issue...They were packed to the gills with dressed up Lincoln Parkers.  Is it really necessary to wear four inch heels and white halter dresses?  This is a chain
column8: after all.  Am I really so far out of the "scene" here in Jefferson Park that I don't think I should have to dress up for a casual dinner
column9: and I don't think that hundreds of people go out to eat at 9:00 pm?  Or is this some weird anomaly to the pretentious Lincoln Park crowd?
